results.title: The Satiric eye
results.creator_credit: DEFA Studio, Hungarofilm and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents several animated pieces which satirize man in society. Illustrative sequences include a corpse which laughs at everyone’s grief; red tape which cannot be cut at the dedication of a bridge; and a lion that eats his tamer during a performance at a circus.
results.creator_credit_for_label: DEFA Studio, Hungarofilm and Learning Corporation of America

results.title: The Santhia story
results.brief_description: The “Santhia” after a disastrous fire sank in the Hooghly River, India, where she lay untouched in the mud for two years. She was only nineteen feet from the wharf and was a menace to shipping. Captain J. P. Williams of the United Salvage Pty Ltd was given the task of raising her. The film shows the whole of the salvage operations and illustrates the various stages by diagrams. The divers go down into the thick mud of the fast-moving river to reconnoitre. They place pressure jets for bringing up the mud, place electrically fired explosive charges for removing the superstructures. Finally, the hull is raised by huge cranes and cleaned and towed away to be broken up by ship-wreckers. The whole salvage operation took nine months. From the series “Epics of salvage”.

results.title: The Sands of Yellow Rock
results.creator_credit: Jack Gardiner, John Kingsford-Smith and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Surveys the decay and decline of the Wollambi Valley area, N.S.W., and shows the investigations carried out by the Hunter Valley Research Foundation. Indicates methods used to check erosion and flooding.

results.title: The Sand castle = Le Chateau de sable
results.creator_credit: Co Hoedeman, Gaston Sarault, Pierre Moretti and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A fable of great humor and appeal, The Sand Castle is the story of the Sandman and the creatures he sculpts out of sand. Under his direction, they build a castle and celebrate the completion of their new home, only to be interrupted by an uninvited guest. The wind blows, and the castle crumbles. The filmmaker leaves the door open to various interpretations. Sound film without words.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 8 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sadao Funatoko, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Senkoska Film Company
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, is about the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is to hunt down his enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This tape, Volume eight, consists of four episodes. “Dogan the Master ninja”: Only eighty miles separates Lord Sadanobu from his destination. Of the original ten, six of the Iga ninja have died. To assist the remaining ninjas Momocki Genkuro attempts to recruit a fearsome ninja, Dogan, the master of Iga ninja. “The Stolen case”: Shintaro requests the assistance of Dogan’s pupils as does Genkuro. Genjuro convinces Dogan that Shintaro is guilty of murder. “Wolf ninja”: The three pupils of Dogan join Shintaro. Genkuro recruits the Wolf ninjas to assist his attacks on Sadanobu. “The Last duel”: Genkuro has one last chance to stop Sadanobu from reaching Kyoto. The ninjas, and their respective leaders, face each other in an almighty showdown. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 7 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sadao Funatoko, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Senkoska Film Company
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, revolves around the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is hunting down enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This disc, Volume seven, consists of three episodes. “The Face-stealer”: As Lord Sadanobu continues his journey the Iga ninja organise a surprise assault on his party. Toma artfully disguises himself as Tombei (Shintaro’s faithful assistant) and attacks Shintaro. “The Mysterious pilgrims”: The ninjas hired to guard Sadanobu recover from poisoning at the hands of the Iga ninjas, who continue to obstruct Sadanobu’s journey. Shintaro, Momocki Genkuro, and their respective ninjas, engage in ruthless combat. “Hide and seek death”: Lord Sadanobu arrives at Mya shrine, just 108 miles short of Kyoto - as he is to complete his journey by sea, Momocki Genkuro and his ninjas plan an ambush. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of action, martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 6 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sadao Funatoko, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Senkoska Film Company
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, revolves around the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is hunting down enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This disc, Volume six, consists of three episodes. “Betrayed by a ninja” Leading the murderous Iga ninja, Momocki Genkuro uses mind tricks and artful disguise to capture Shintaro. Within the ranks of the ninjas dissent surfaces. Lord Sadanobu and his party settle for the night in a remote castle continuing their important journey to Kyoto. “A Spy’s revenge” Two ninjas battle it out in a furious display of expertise. Okei, a skilled ninja, blames Shintaro for her brother’s death and seeks revenge. “Poison blade” Momocki Genkuro, who possesses outstanding powers and skill, confronts Shintaro in the forest. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of action, martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 5 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Sadao Funatoko, Nishimura Shun-ichi and Senkoska Film Company
results.brief_description: Japanese television show from the 1960s, “The Samurai”, set in 17th century medieval Japan, revolves around the fortunes of Shintaro, a master swordsman and samurai. His eternal quest is hunting down enemies, namely ninjas, who dress in black and are armed with a diverse array of weapons as well as being schooled in the art of hypnotic illusion. This disc, Volume five, consists of three episodes. “Secret mission to Kyoto”: When a high-ranking minister, Lord Sadanobu, plans a trip to Kyoto, he has a secret mission planned - to foil a conspiracy against the government. Numerous Iga ninja are hired to assassinate Sadanobu before he reaches his destination, led by the fanatical Momocki Genkuro. Against his wishes, Shintaro agrees to protect Sadanobu on his treacherous journey. “Rocket attack”: The Iga ninjas continue their cunning assaults on Lord Sadanobu and his party. Shintaro remains instrumental in outwitting them. “The Bribe”: As Sadonubo continues his journey, the ninjas plan to kill him whilst he rests at a remote country inn. An impoverished woman is bribed into assisting them. Two sets of ninjas engage in a furious showdown. Authentic locations, inventive kung fu action and a wonderful score make “The Samurai” an imaginative and fun action series, a clever combination of martial arts, swordplay and magic in a historical setting. Cast includes Koichi Ose and Fuyukichi Maki; original music by Hiroki Ogawa; written by Masaru Igami and Yasushi Kato. Please note, dubbed into English.

results.title: The Samurai. Volume 2
results.creator_credit: Toru Toyama, Toshio Kobayashi and Senkosha
results.brief_description: Three episodes from the classic 60’s television series. Shintaro and Tombie, “the Mist” travel feudal Japan, fighting evil, and protecting the innocent. “Living Death”: Shintaro and his followers are protecting the Prince from the Death Ninja. Disguised as an old man the Death Ninja breaks through their defence. Tombei is captured and Shintaro faces his enemy in a fight to the death. “The Spider”: Shintaro is sent to recover gold hidden in Koga country and is lured into a trap by a female Ninja. “Musai’s curse”: The Fuma Ninja have returned to reclaim their lands and the Fire Dragon Mirror in the castle. A deadly curse is placed on the Lord of the castle and his daughter is taken hostage. Who ya gonna call?

Disguised as an old man the Death Ninja breaks through their defence. Tombei is captured and Shintaro faces his enemy in a fight to the death. “The Spider”: Shintaro is sent to recover gold hidden in Koga country and is lured into a trap by a female Ninja. “Musai’s curse”: The Fuma Ninja have returned to reclaim their lands and the Fire Dragon Mirror in the castle. A deadly curse is placed on the Lord of the castle and his daughter is taken hostage. Who ya gonna call?
